action.action-desc: Ms. Matsui (for herself, Mr. Dunn of Florida, Mr. Thompson of California, and Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend titles XVIII and XIX of the Social Security Act and title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to refine the set of information sources for determining coverage of certain drugs and biologicals used in the treatment or management of a rare disease or condition, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Providing Realistic Opportunity To Equal and Comparable Treatment for Rare Act or the PROTECT Rare Act.

section.header: Coverage of certain drugs used in treatment or management of rare disease or condition

paragraph.text: Section 1861(t)(2) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(t)(2)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting after regimen the following: , or in the treatment or management of a disease or condition affecting 200,000 or fewer individuals in the United States,; and

clause.text: in subclause (I), by striking , or at the end and inserting a semicolon;
in subclause (II), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following new subclause:

subclause.text: in the case of a drug that is used in the treatment or management of a disease or condition affecting 200,000 or fewer individuals in the United States, such use is supported by peer-reviewed medical literature, including clinical guidelines, and is not reviewed unfavorably in the compendia described in section 1927(g)(1)(B)(i), or listed as a contraindication in the FDA-approved labeling.

paragraph.header: Medically accepted uses of covered part d drugs in treating rare conditions
paragraph.text: Section 1860D–2(e)(4)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–102(e)(4)(A)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii); and
by inserting after clause (i)(II) the following new clause:

clause.text: in the case of a covered part D drug used in the treatment or management of a disease or condition affecting 200,000 or fewer individuals in the United States, in section 1861(t)(2)(B); and

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection apply with respect to items and services furnished on or after the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Section 1927(k)(6) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396r–8(k)(6)) is amended to read as follows:
The term medically accepted indication means any use for a covered drug—

subparagraph.text: which is approved under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act;
which is supported by one or more citations included or approved for inclusion in any of the compendia described in subsection (g)(1)(B)(i); or
in the case of a drug used to treat or manage a disease or condition affecting 200,000 or fewer individuals in the United States—

clause.text: the use of such drug is supported by peer-reviewed medical literature, including clinical guidelines; and
is not reviewed unfavorably in the compendia described in subsection (g)(1)(B)(i), or listed as a contraindication in the FDA-approved labeling.

paragraph.text: Section 1927(d)(4)(C) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396r–8(d)(4)(C)) is amended by striking compendia and inserting sources.
The amendments made by this subsection apply with respect to covered outpatient drugs furnished on or after the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Subpart II of part A of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–19) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Expedited processes for review associated with certain drugs used in treatment or management of a rare disease or condition
section.text: A group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage shall provide a mechanism for expedited formulary exception, reconsideration, and appeal of any denial of coverage for a drug or biological—

paragraph.text: approved by the Food and Drug Administration;
for which the use is related to treatment or management of a disease or condition affecting 200,000 or fewer individuals in the United States; and

the use of which is supported by the FDA-approved label or peer-reviewed literature, including clinical guidelines, and that is not reviewed unfavorably in the compendia described in section 1927(g)(1)(B)(i)) of the Social Security Act or listed as a contraindication in the FDA-approved labeling.
The amendment made by this subsection applies with respect to plan years beginning on or after the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
